H0.text: What element is mixed with Iron to make cast iron. Silicon

H1.text: What element is mixed with Iron to make cast iron. Manganese

H2.text: What element is mixed with Iron to make cast iron. Chromium

H3.text: What element is mixed with Iron to make cast iron. Carbon

A4.text: High percentage of silicon forces carbon out of solution, forming graphite and producing grey cast iron.

A5.text: To counter the effects of sulfur, manganese is added, because the two form into manganese sulfide instead of iron sulfide.

A6.text: Carbon combines with iron at high temperatures to form iron carbide cementite.

A7.text: Removing the impurities from pig iron, but leaving 2–4% carbon, results in cast iron.

A9.text: Adding chromium to steel, its resistance to corrosion can be enhanced, creating stainless steel.

A10.text: Adding silicon will alter its electrical characteristics, producing silicon steel.
